thread.title: Charles Barkley doesn't care about the Knicks: 'Spike Lee don't want to watch this s—'
thread.title_full: Charles Barkley doesn't care about the Knicks: 'Spike Lee don't want to watch this s—'

author: Joe Rivera (Joseph.Rivera@performgroup.com)
title: Charles Barkley doesn't care about the Knicks: 'Spike Lee don't want to watch this s—'
text:
February 23, 2017 11:14pm   11:14pm EST Charles Barkley has no filter, and that routinely leads to hilarious results. Charles Barkley (Getty Images) 
Updated at 11:14 p.m. ET 
Updated at 11:14 p.m. ET 
Charles Barkley made like coffee and delivered a classic roast of the Knicks on Thursday night. 
During TNT's pregame show, Barkley heckled the network and apologized to viewers incessantly for airing the Knicks-Cavaliers matchup over the Pelicans-Rockets game that was in the same time slot. DeMarcus Cousins made his debut with New Orleans, and the Knicks were trounced by Cleveland, 119-103. 
After the game, Barkley didn't ease off the gas in his dislike for the New York franchise. 
While TNT aired highlights of the game, Chuck roasted the Knicks some more, this time dropping an s-bomb while he was at it. (WARNING: Bad language.) Charles Barkley on Spike Lee and the Knicks đđ­ pic.twitter.com/UXWtyWhSAY â Dose of Hoops (@DoseofHoops) February 24, 2017 
Barkley was instantly remorseful upon realizing his naughty, naughty language. @NBAonTNT chucks permanent face whenever TNT puts the knicks on.Lmao "don't nobody wanna see that đŠ" @SHAQ #charlesbarkley pic.twitter.com/UvFk6Gi9q0 â Dfs_Ref (@Dfs_Ref) February 24, 2017 
Not to mention, the "NBA on TNT" crew is really, really fast. â Brandon Clack (@BrandonJClack) February 24, 2017 
All things considered, Barkley's probably not wrong. 
The Knicks stood pat at the trade deadline and just aren't any fun to watch, even with Kristaps Porzingis, Carmelo Anthony and Derrick Rose. The team is 23-35 and 12th in the Eastern Conference, and Porzingis was injured Thursday night. We're not sure anyone really wants to watch this . . .Â stuffÂ anymore. Even Knicks fans. 
Keep doing you, Chuck.
